title: As a property slump drags on, China's economy looks more resilient than it feels
description: By some measures, China's economy is looking resilient, with strong exports and breakthroughs in artificial intelligence
content:
HONG KONG (AP) — By some measures, China’s economy is looking resilient, with strong exports and breakthroughs in artificial intelligence and other advanced technologies.

title: UPSC isn't useless, but carries risk: Experts urge reform over rejection
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes careers, hiring, and governance, experts question whether the UPSC Civil Services Examination still justifies years of preparation. While not obsolete, they stress that success now demands clear intent, time-bound planning, and transferable skills, warning against blind persistence in an AI-driven economy.
content: As artificial intelligence rewires careers, classrooms, and hiring pipelines, a quiet anxiety is spreading through India’s coaching hubs and student hostels. In a world racing toward skills, speed, and adaptability, does the UPSC Civil Services Exami... [5912 chars]

title: AI Memory Demand Propels Kioxia to World’s Best-Performing Stock
description: Artificial intelligence’s insatiable appetite for data storage has delivered Japanese memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. world-beating stock gains this year, a sign that the AI boom is alive and well despite recent market jitters.
content:
Artificial intelligence’s insatiable appetite for data storage has delivered Japanese memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. world-beating stock gains this year, a sign that the AI boom is alive and well despite recent market jitters.

title: Two new subtypes of MS found in ‘exciting’ breakthrough
description: Exclusive: Scientists uncovered biological strands using artificial intelligence and hope discovery will revolutionise treatment
content:
Scientists have discovered two new subtypes of multiple sclerosis with the aid of artificial intelligence, paving the way for personalised treatments and better outcomes for patients.
Millions of people have the disease globally – but treatments are ... [3880 chars]

title: Admit It, You’re in a Relationship With AI
description: Amelia Miller has an unusual business card. When I saw the title of “Human-AI Relationship Coach” at a recent technology event, I presumed she was capitalizing on the rise of chatbot romances to make those strange bonds stronger. It turned out the opposite was true. Artificial intelligence tools were subtly manipulating people and displacing their need to ask others for advice. That was having a detrimental impact on real relationships with humans.
content: (Bloomberg Opinion) -- Amelia Miller has an unusual business card. When I saw the title of “Human-AI Relationship Coach” at a recent technology event, I presumed she was capitalizing on the rise of chatbot romances to make those strange bonds stronge... [4752 chars]

title: Google’s ‘The Thinking Game’ crosses 200M views in 4 weeks
description: Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, revealed on December 28, 2025, that the documentary The Thinking Game has crossed 200 million views on YouTube in only four weeks. The film offers a rare, behind-the-scenes look inside an artificial general intelligence, or AGI, lab and closely follows the work behind AlphaFold, the Nobel Prize–winning AI project […] | financialexpress.com

title: Meta Acquires Startup Manus to Bolster AI Business
description:
Meta Platforms Inc. has agreed to acquire Singapore-based AI startup Manus, which makes an artificial intelligence agent that it sells to small and medium-sized businesses.
The deal is part of a broader push by Meta to build a business around its massive AI investment, which has captured the focus of Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg and become the company’s top priority.
content:
